data.title: Ministry of justice in Armenia
data.meta_description: This article explains all the information related to the ministry of justice in Armenia, where legal entities are registered.
data.text:
The ministry of Justice Armenia is an Armenian government agency that possesses executive authority and executes policies of the Government of Armenia in sectors that are closely associated with laws and regulations. The ministry oversees the operations of the following agencies; Compulsory Enforcement Service, Penitentiary Service, and Probation Service. The ministry was established in 1918 by the newly formed Republic of Armenia’s government of Hovhannes Kajaznuni. Additionally, the Ministry is responsible for the registration of political parties in Armenia. As of March 2021, the Ministry of Justice had The Ministry also oversees the registration of political parties in Armenia. There are 91 political parties registered with the Ministry of Justice as of March 2021. The Ministry of Justice of Armenia includes 14 structural subdivisions, 7 separate subdivisions, as well as 7 legal entities operating in different spheres of the Republic of Armenia Ministry of Justice

Agency for State Register of Legal Entities

The Agency for State Registration of Legal Persons provides services in the field of state registration of legal persons — ensuring the functions of state registration of legal persons (except banks and credit organizations) and individual entrepreneurs being established in the territory of the Republic of Armenia, as well as registration of separate subdivisions and institutions of legal persons and media and mass media registration.

Tatev Mkrtchyan is the head of the State Register Agency for Legal Entities.
